net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.efsm

Class EFSMCompiler

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.AbortableCompiler
      • net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.efsm.EFSMCompiler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.sourceforge.waters.model.analysis.Abortable

    public class EFSMCompiler
extends AbortableCompiler

    A subtask of the ModuleCompiler to compile EFSM guards.

    This compiler accepts a normalised module (ModuleProxy) as input and produces another module as output. It expands all guard/action blocks by partitioning the events, and replaces all variables by simple components. Event arrays, event aliases, foreach constructs, and instantiations are not allowed in the input. Constant alias declarations are only parsed to collect enumeration atoms. All these constructs should be expanded by a previous call the the module instance compiler (ModuleInstanceCompiler).

    The EFA compiler ensures that the resultant module only contains nodes of the following types:

    • ConstantAliasProxy, where the defined type is an enumeration type.
    • EventDeclProxy, where only simple events are defined, i.e., the list of ranges is guaranteed to be empty. Also the guards must be normalised, which means that each occurrence of a given event in an automaton has the same guard/action block, and occurrences of the same event in different automata either have the same or no guard/action block.
    • SimpleComponentProxy.

    Algorithm

    The EFSM compiler proceeds in three passes:

    1. Identify all components (simple or variable) and their state space.
    2. Collect and split guards.
    3. Build output automata.
    Author:
    Robi Malik, Roger Su

      • ATTRIBUTES_UPDATES

        public static final Map<String,String> ATTRIBUTES_UPDATES
        An unmodifiable attribute map that identifies a simple component as the ":updates" automaton generated by the EFSMNormaliser. It contains a single entry mapping the key ATTRIB_UPDATES to the empty string.
